title: DANGEROUS LIES is DANGEROUSLY BAD!
author: Think Story
comment:
Ralph Wiggum: "I'm in danger."


Thought I'd have a little with this video. Hope you enjoy! 😃
I just love how they took forever to call the ambulance
The Husband was EXTREMELY unlike able
You know a movie was bad when you watch the full movie without remembering the name of anyone in it

There was little character development, no backstory and it's hard to understand why the characters are the way they are and what happened before. It was suspenseful, but nothing developed enough to be solidified within the timeframe of the movie. Literally, everything we learned about the villain of the story came from a character that was untrustworthy due to shady behavior from not wanting to be poor, just to have him die minutes later. I finished the movie thinking, what was the truth? How did all these characters intertwine, why were there no flashbacks with the old man and the gardener, and how did the gardener actually die?  Also, were the documents false? Did Katie live up to her good samaritan persona and tell the truth about the will? and if so, if or not, how is she still living in the house? It felt rushed, could have been a mini series that provided more details.
description:
Netflix's latest original thriller "Dangerous Lies" offers a predictable plot riddled with holes. Join me as we have some fun reviewing this film starring Camila Mendes and Jessie Usher.
